function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Using online methods to collect data during a stay-at-home regulation period.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Distributing the questionnaire through private and group channels in social networking apps.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Restricting participation to indonesian residents living overseas.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of awareness and knowledge among indonesian residents about covid-19","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Inadequate public attitudes and behavioral compliance towards disease prevention","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Insufficient sociodemographic data analysis for targeted intervention","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of adequate knowledge and prevention practice related to covid-19","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Inadequate health protocols and measures taken by the government","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Attention of countries focused on critical intervention for pandemic prevention and mitigation","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Rapid global outbreak of covid-19","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of knowledge and attitude on covid-19 promotion and prevention","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Predicted increase in cases without vaccine availability","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Increased risk of contagious disease propagation in urban environments","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Interpersonal transmission risks due to inadequate indoor and outdoor points of interest pois in proportion to resident density and demands.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Travel-related risks for vulnerable communities due to lack of job opportunities near neighborhoods and insufficient support for active transportation.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of affordable housing with resilient building typologies in dense areas, leading to spatial disparities for vulnerable communities.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of accessible park areas per capita","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Spatial inequalities for vulnerable populations","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of evidence for the benefits of active transportation modes in relation to generalized biking and walking behaviors","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Correlation between accessible shopping mall area and lower disease case rates in lower-income communities","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Direct link between spatial allocations of points of interest and infection rate","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Long commute time by public transit as a concern for urban attribute","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Total viral load and risk of inhaling infectious aerosols increase with time spent in confined space","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of flexible mobility choices for long-distance travelers on public transit","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Potential ramifications of overcrowding in apartment buildings","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of data and evidence relating architectural parameters to pandemic resilience","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Sustainable urban sprawl leading to inadequate pandemic response infrastructures","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"High residential building density may facilitate disease transmission","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"High office and retail building density may lead to interzonal disease transmissions","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Building-level crowding and room-level crowding can facilitate disease transmission","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"High residential building density and building-level crowding","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Inadequate covid-19 testing capacity in the early days of the pandemic","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Less predictable human activities due to behavioral changes related to modification of non-pharmaceutical interventions","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"High residential building density and longer public transport commute time are associated with higher disease case rates dcr .","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Crowded living conditions, particularly within young and low-income communities, may impair pandemic resilience.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Limited accommodation of active mobility as alternative commute modes may impact urban resilience to pandemics.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lower-income population residing in low-rent areas","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Large households with lower urban density and limited
